snippet: The 1856 One-Cent Magenta that Stuart Weitzman, the shoe designer, bought anonymously for $9.5 million last year will be displayed at the National Postal Museum in Washington for two and a half years.
abstract: Shoe designer Stuart Weitzman is revealed as buyer of unique 1856 One-Cent Magenta stamp from British Guiana; he bought stamp anonymously at 2014 auction for $9.5 million; he will lend it to National Postal Museum in Washington for two and a half years.
lead_paragraph: The 1856 One-Cent Magenta that Stuart Weitzman, the shoe designer, bought anonymously for $9.5 million last year will be displayed at the National Postal Museum in Washington for two and a half years.

headline.main: A Stamp, Tiny and Rare, Fulfills a Boyhood Dream
headline.print_headline: A Stamp, Tiny and Rare, Fulfills a Boyhood Dream
